intro: Echium creticum subsp. granatense, commonly known as the Granate Thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branched. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
